analytic.title: A Lost Greek Text on Physiognomy by Archelaos of Alexandria in Arabic Translation Transmitted by Ibn Abī Ṭālib al-Dimashqī: An Edition and Translation of the Fragments with Glossaries of the Greek, Syriac, and Arabic Traditions

monogr.title: Visualizing the Invisible with the Human Body: Physiognomy and Ekphrasis in the Ancient World

body.bibl: Thomann, Johannes. “A Lost Greek Text on Physiognomy by Archelaos of Alexandria in Arabic Translation Transmitted by Ibn Abī Ṭālib Al-Dimashqī: An Edition and Translation of the Fragments with Glossaries of the Greek, Syriac, and Arabic Traditions.” In Visualizing the Invisible with the Human Body: Physiognomy and Ekphrasis in the Ancient World, edited by J. Cale Johnson and Alessandro Stavru, 443–84. Berlin: Walter de Gruyter, 2019.

Johannes Thomann, A Lost Greek Text on Physiognomy by Archelaos of Alexandria in Arabic Translation Transmitted by Ibn Abī Ṭālib Al-Dimashqī: An Edition and Translation of the Fragments with Glossaries of the Greek, Syriac, and Arabic Traditions, in Visualizing the Invisible with the Human Body: Physiognomy and Ekphrasis in the Ancient World, ed. J. Cale Johnson and Alessandro Stavru (Berlin: Walter de Gruyter, 2019), 443–84.
